title: ollama/ollama
summary: Ollama’s official CLI and server for running Llama 2, Mistral, Gemma, and other LLMs locally with a single command.

title: ollama-js
summary: Official JavaScript/TypeScript client for the Ollama API, published to npm as ‘ollama’.

title: ollama-python
summary: Official Python client for Ollama, available on PyPI as ‘ollama’.

title: langchain-ollama
summary: LangChain integration package (langchain-ollama on PyPI) for using Ollama models in chains, agents, and RAG pipelines.

title: ollama-webui
summary: Full-featured ChatGPT-style web UI for Ollama (now renamed ‘Open WebUI’).

title: ollama-cli
summary: Community-built interactive CLI with conversation history and model switcher.

title: ollama-copilot
summary: VS-Code extension that turns Ollama models into inline coding copilots.

title: ollama4j
summary: Java/Kotlin client library for Ollama, published to Maven Central.

title: ollama-rb
summary: Community Ruby gem for interacting with the Ollama API.

title: ollama-csharp
summary: .NET/C# SDK for Ollama with async streaming support.

title: ollama-docker
summary: Official Docker image and compose stacks for CPU & GPU deployments.

title: ollama-helm
summary: Helm chart to deploy Ollama on Kubernetes with GPU autoscaling.

title: ollama-haystack
summary: Haystack 2.0 integration package for using Ollama generators and embedders.

title: ollama-rag
summary: Minimal RAG example using Ollama + llama-index to chat with local PDFs.

title: ollama-discord-bot
summary: Discord bot that exposes Ollama models to servers with slash commands.

title: ollama-slack-bot
summary: Lightweight Slack bot server using Bolt JS and Ollama API.

title: ollama-npm
summary: Official npm package providing JS/TS bindings for the Ollama API.

title: ollama-pypi
summary: Official PyPI package for Python integration with Ollama.

title: ollama-models-hub
summary: Community-curated list of custom GGUF models ready for ‘ollama create’.

title: ollama-reddit
summary: Active subreddit for announcements, troubleshooting, and showcase projects.
